lead_paragraph: An article yesterday about human rights organizations' concern over reports of the execution of captured Taliban soldiers by other Afghan factions paraphrased incorrectly from a comment by Sidney Jones, the Asia director of Human Rights Watch. She said the Geneva Conventions do apply to the internal conflicts in Afghanistan, as well as to international conflicts. She did not say it was unclear whether they applied. The conventions require the humane treatment of prisoners in both kinds of conflict. The obligations for treatment of prisoners of war -- that term is applied only to international conflicts -- are more rigorous.
abstract: Correction of November 30 article on concern by human rights organizations over reports of execution of captured Taliban soldiers by other Afghan factions
